name: Substrate Composition
functionStatement: Supports aquatic habitats through streambed material and bedform dynamics. Enhances habitat complexity and streambank stability.
descriptionMarkdown: Combines substrate size distribution, embeddedness, and consolidation or armoring to assess pore space and habitat quality.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Use a Wolman pebble count when feasible; estimate embeddedness; note consolidation or armor with a grab test. If needed, use qualitative bins for dominant substrate and embeddedness.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Fine-dominated bed or heavily locked armor.
Criteria: Embeddedness >75% or severe armoring; minimal pore space.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Fines blanket bed or strong armor limits pore space.
Criteria: Embeddedness about 50-75% or surface locked.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Slight fines or coarsening; moderate embeddedness.
Criteria: Embeddedness about 25-50%; light crusting/armoring.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Gravel-cobble mix with low fines and open pore space.
Criteria: <25% embeddedness; little/no crusting or armor.
